entries.meaning: One who is capable of adapting to differing situations.
examples: He was an able adapter, and could easily adjust to the differences when the company changed ownership.

entries.meaning: One who adapts a thing, e.g. a play.
examples: The critic gave rave reviews to the adapter of the ancient play, who worked to give the text more relevance to the modern day.

definitionGroups.group: A device or application used to achieve operative compatibility between devices that otherwise are incompatible.

entries.meaning: Specifically, a device that permits two, three, or more plugs to be used at a single electrical power point.
examples: The wall outlet sprouted an electrical monstrosity of adapters plugged into adapters that sparked ominously.

entries.meaning: Specifically, a device that allows one format of plug to be used with a different format of socket.
examples: We bought adapters to use our three-prong plugs in the two-prong, unpolarized outlets of the old house.

entries.meaning: Specifically, an AC adapter: a device that reduces voltage and converts AC to DC to allow a battery-powered device to use mains power.
examples: I lost my cellphone's adapter so I couldn't recharge it.
